name: "Super Mario 64" Stages 4-6 Online Quiz | Super Mario 64 | 10 Questions

questions.text: How many stars require you to take the slide in the cottage in "Cool, Cool Mountain"?
questions.explanation:
Two.

	To complete the tasks 'Slip Slidin' Away' and 'Big Penguin Race', you need to take the slide.  If you want to complete the track quicker, there's a 'somewhat' hidden path through the wall of the track, but you can only take it to get the first star.  If the secret path is used in the 'Big Penguin Race', you'll have to redo the course.

questions.text: How many little penguins can be found in the "Cool, Cool Mountain" level?
questions.explanation:
Two.

	The one penguin at the start of the level needs to be returned to his parent at the base of the mountain in the 'Li'l Penguin Lost' task, but you can find a second penguin on top of the cottage at the base of the mountain.  If you return this one to the parent, it says that it isn't hers.

questions.text: In "Big Boo's Haunt", how many Boos must you defeat before the Big Boo will appear in the lobby of the house?
questions.explanation:
Five & 5.

	This little bit of information is required for thew very first task, 'Go on a Ghost Hunt'.  You can find the five Boos scattered around the ground floor of the mansion, and to defeat them, you have to ground pound them when they aren't invisible.  When they're defeated, each'll give you a blue coin.

questions.text: How many tasks in "Big Boo's Haunt" require you to defeat the Big Boo?
questions.explanation:
Three.

	The very first task, 'Going on a Ghost Hunt' requires that you defeat him in the lobby of the mansion, the second task, 'Ride Big Boo's Merry-Go-Round' faces you off with him in the basement, and the fifth task, 'Big Boo's Balcony' is the third encounter.  Each time you fight him it's no different.  You must ground pound him three times when he's not invisible.

questions.text: In what part of the mansion in "Big Boo's Haunt" can you find the big Mr. I?
questions.explanation:
The attic.

	To reach Mr. I in the sixth task, 'Eye to Eye in the Secret Room', you must have activated the Vanish Cap.  Once you have, you need to put it on on the second floor, then head to the attic and enter the Boo wall.  You defeat Big Mr. I like any other Mr. I in the mansion.  You spin in circles around him.

questions.text: What is the name of the 'beast' in the bottom level of "Hazy Maze Cave"?
questions.explanation:
Dorrie.

	To reach the underground lake, you'll need to sneak past some rolling boulders and take an elevator down to it.  Dorrie will be swimming around the island in the center of the lake, and you can climb onto her back pretty easily.  If you ground pound her back, she'll let you ride on her head, and from there, you can controll her to get the level's first star.

questions.text: What enemies can be found in the Metal Cap side-quest?
questions.explanation:
Snufits.

	Snufits are floating enemies that will shoot little pellets at you to attack.  to defeat them, you can simply jump into them while you're Metal Mario, or you can punch or kick them in the air.  To reach the Metal Cap side-quest, you need to take Dorrie to a certain platform in the undreground lake of "Hazy Maze Cave".  Once again, you can collect the eight red coins here for a star.

questions.text: What star in "Hazy Maze Cave" requires the Metal Cap?
questions.explanation:
#3.

	The task 'Metal-Head Mario Can Move' requires the Metal Cap because you need to wear it to take a path along the bottom of Dorrie's lake.  At the end of the path, you can land on a switch which will open a gate to a room containing the star.  Watch out in this roo, there's some pits that you can easily fall into when you're crossing them with the long jump.

questions.text: How many tasks in "Hazy Maze Cave" actually require that you enter the maze?
questions.explanation:
Two.

	Star #4 ('Navigating the Toxic Maze') and #5 ('A-maze-ing Emergency Exit') involve finding two different exits to the toxic, hazy maze.  When inside the maze, a green toxic gas will damage Mario every little while, but you can resist it by wearing the Metal Caps scattered around the maze.  You can exit the maze through a third exit if you would like to leave, and you can refill your health by collecting the coins in the cave.

questions.text: How many pedestals does Mario have to ground pound in the castle to open up the Vanish Cap level?
questions.explanation:
Two.

	When Mario slams down these two pedestals, the moat around peach's Castle will drain and Mario can drop into the hole containing the Vanish Cap side-quest.  Much like the Wing Cap and Metal Cap, you can collect eight red coins for a Secret Star, and you need to knock down the switch at the end of the level to activate the Vanish Cap blocks.
